intro: Mulinum gandogeri, commonly known as the Ethiopian mullein, is a perennial herb native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at elevations above 2,000 meters. It has lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Mulinum gandogeri is valued for its medicinal properties, with traditional uses including the treatment of respiratory ailments.
